resources.string: 1. Your phone may be unlocked by someone with a similar appearance or objects shaped like you.
2. When enrolling your face, make sure your facial features are not covered by your hair, sunglasses, a face mask, heavy make-up, or clothing.
3. Avoid recording your face when lighting is too strong or too weak. Make sure your camera lens is free of dirt.
4. Make sure your face is distinct and easily recognisable for better chances of successful recognition.
After enrolling your face, you can use it to quickly unlock your phone. We follow the Privacy Policy during face recognition.
1. When registering or verifying your fingerprint, please press lightly on the fingerprint button and hold it for a moment.
2. Do not use different fingers when registering a fingerprint.
3. Please avoid doing it in a strongly-lit environment.
4. We recommend that you replace or remove the protection film and re-register your fingerprint to improve the success rate of unlocking.
5. The phone can use fingerprint recognition for quick unlocking and payment. We follow the Privacy Policy during this process.

To zoom", quickly tap the screen 3 times with 1 finger. 1. Drag 2 or more fingers to scroll. 2. Pinch in or out with 2 or more fingers to adjust the zoom level.
To "zoom in temporarily", quickly tap the screen 3 times and hold on the third time. From here, you can: a. Drag your finger to explore the screen, or b. Lift your finger to return to the unzoomed state.
The Magnification feature works everywhere except for the keyboard and the navigation bar.
Magnification may slightly increase app response time."

While respecting and protecting your privacy, each time you use our products, we (including our affiliates) and our third-party partners will show targeted ads to you through our advertising platform based on your preferences and interests. This Privacy Statement is designed to explain to you how we collect and process your personal information in connection with advertising.

You can turn on Limit Ad Tracking in \"Settings - Additional Settings - Device and Privacy - Device ID and Ads\", in order to restrict targeted advertising based on your device ID. After you have turned on Limit Ad Tracking, the status will be synced to our advertising platform and our third-party partners. We will respect your choice and restrict the delivery of targeted advertising to you.
After you have turned on Limit Ad Tracking, you may still receive ads, but the ads may be less relevant to you.

After you have selected Reset Device ID, your original device ID will be reset, and all data associated with your original device ID will be cleared. You can select \"Reset Device ID\" in \"Settings - Additional Settings - Device and Privacy - Device ID and Ads\".

If you choose to turn on \"Limit Ad Tracking\" and later choose to turn off it, we will generate a new Device ID for your device so that we display targeted advertising to you. You can choose to turn off Limit Ad Tracking in \"Settings - Additional Settings - Device and Privacy - Device ID and Ads\".

"For the processing of personal information related to the advertising service, please refer to our Privacy Policy for specific privacy issues that are not set forth in this Privacy Statement (including but not limited to \"How We Retain Your Personal Information,\" \"Your Rights to Your Personal Information,\" \"How We Process Children's Personal Information,\" \"Third-party Service Providers and Their Services,\" \"How Your Personal Information Is Transferred Globally,\" etc.)."

You can turn on Limit Ad Tracking in \"Settings - Security - Device ID & Ads\". After you turn this feature on, this setting will be synced to our advertising platform and our third-party partners. We will respect your choice and will no longer push device ID-based ads to you.

After you select Reset Device ID, your original device ID will be reset, and all data associated with your original device ID will be cleared. To do this, go to \"Settings - Security - Device ID & Ads\".

If you choose to turn on Limit Ad Tracking and later choose to turn off it, a new device ID will be generated for your device so that we can display targeted advertising to you. To turn the feature off, go to \"Settings - Security - Device ID & Ads\".

During your use of our products and services, we may provide advertising services to you based on the information we collect from your device as well as how you interact with our products or services. Such information includes:

\u0009 a.Device Information", such as device name, device model, operating system version, and device ID. \u0009 b."Log Information and Operation Records", such as click records, usage records, and impression records. \u0009 c."Device Location ", such as GPS or network location. \u0009 d."Other Information, such as network environment.

a.Device information, including the device name, device model, operating system version, and device ID
  b.Log information and user activity, such as touch events, phone use records, and impressions
  c.Location information, including GPS and network positioning
  d.Other information, for example, network environments
We may display ads in products such as the operating system, Browser, App Market, Videos, or social media or news apps from our third-party partners.

To better protect your privacy, we and our partners push ads based on your device ID. Specifically, a unique device ID is generated for each device, and you can choose to reset the device ID at any time. This allows us to associate your personal information with your device ID so that we can provide you with a more relevant, customised, and targeted advertising experience.
In order to provide you with better ads experience, we may create different user segments, which are groups of people who share similar characteristics, and accordingly display targeted ads.

Sensitive personal information that you have authorised us to collect, such as biometric and health information, is not accessible on our advertising platform, and will not be used for advertising purposes or shared with any third-party partner. We will obtain your explicit consent if sensitive personal information will be used for such purposes.

In order to show ads to you, we will share your device ID and your personal information associated with your device ID (such as profiles) with our third-party partners. Third-party partners may display ads related to your interests based on your device ID, and then measure the effectiveness of the ads by extracting information such as touch events, phone use records, and impressions from your browsing history or from your device using cookies or similar technologies.

"If you don't wish to receive targeted advertising based on your preferences and interests, you can choose to opt out of receiving targeted ads from us and our third-party partners by turning on Limit Ad Tracking."

II. How We Use Your Personal Information
III. How we disclose your personal information
IV. How to Manage Targeted Advertising

"Your phone's storage is damaged. Please download a firmware package to replace the phone's firmware."
"Your phone's storage is damaged and the data on it cannot be read! You need to reset your phone to continue using it (none of the phone's content or data will be restored)."

"The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt.
To resume using your phone, you will need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you’ll be able to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"You may encrypt your account, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media and other files. After the phone has been encrypted, if you have enabled screen lock (that is, a pattern, digital PIN code, or a password), you must unlock the screen to decrypt the phone each time the phone is powered on. Otherwise, the only decryption method is to restore the factory settings. This will remove all your data.
The encryption process requires at least 1 hour. You must fully charge the battery before encryption, and keep the power on during the entire process of encrypting the phone. Some or all data may be lost if the encryption process is interrupted."
You need to set a lockscreen PIN or password before you can start encryption.

"Encryption was interrupted and can not be completed. Therefore you can no longer use data on the phone.
You need to perform a factory reset before you can continue using your phone. After you reset your phone to factory settings, you can set it up again and restore data from the backup in your Google account to your phone"
"The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you'll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times."

"Even with their eyes protected by the green glasses, Dorothy and her friends were straight away dazzled by the brilliancy of the wonderful City. The streets were lined with beautiful houses all built of green marble and studded everywhere with sparkling emeralds. They walked over a pavement of the same green marble, and where the blocks were joined together were rows of emeralds, set closely, and glittering in the brightness of the sun. The window panes were of green glass; even the sky above the City had a green tint, and the rays of the sun were green.
There were many people — men, women and children — walking about, and they were all dressed in green clothes and had greenish skin. They looked at Dorothy and her strangely assorted company with wondering eyes, and the children all ran away and hid behind their mothers when they saw the Lion; but no one spoke to them. Many shops stood in the street, and Dorothy saw that everything in them was green. Green candy and green popcorn were offered for sale, as well as green shoes, green hats, and green clothes of all sorts. At one place a man was selling green lemonade, and when the children bought it Dorothy could see that they paid for it with green pennies.
There seemed to be no horses nor animals of any kind; the men carried things around in little green carts, which they pushed before them. Everyone seemed happy, content and prosperous."
Chapter XI: The Wonderful Emerald City of Oz

All released apps in OPPO App Store have gone through multiple security and manual tests.

When a background app is using the microphone for recording, the system will prompt you through the status bar. When a background app is using the camera to take photos, the system will prompt you with a pop-up warning asking for permission.

When you use privacy-related functions such as Secure Keyboard, or Private Safe, the system will prevent screen capturing or recording. Screen capturing will be blocked and alerts issued, and screen recording will only record a black screen.
"To avoid fraud, you will be alerted when sensitive words such as \"password \"' or \"account \" and bank account numbers appear in text messages."

We recommend apps from OPPO App Store, because they have been thoroughly tested for security issues. When you are installing apps from other sources, the system will automatically detect the installation packages for security risks.

When you enter sensitive information such as passcode, the system will automatically switch to use OPPO secure keyboard, which does not record your input, connect to the network, or give suggestions, preventing your input from leaking out.
When you use OPPO Browser to access a website, or receive an SMS message containing a URL, the system will automatically check this URL for security issues.
When apps are sending payment request messages or are being installed from anywhere other than trusted stores like OPPO \"App Market\", the system will prompt you to verify your OPPO ID and password.
The system will automatically identify verification codes and separate them for protection. They are prohibited from being accessed by other apps to prevent leakage.
When you connect to Wi-Fi or use payment apps over Wi-Fi, the system will automatically detect whether the current network is secure.

Payment and auto-installation prevention. When games are sending payment request messages or are being installed from anywhere other than trusted stores like OPPO \"App Market \", the system will prompt you to input your OPPO ID and password.
When you enter sensitive information such as a password, the system will automatically switch to use the OPPO secure keyboard to protect your input content from leaking out.
When you download an app from anywhere other than the OPPO App Store, the system will automatically detect whether that installation package is secure.
When you connect to Wi-Fi or use payment apps, the system will automatically detect whether the current network is secure.
The system will automatically identify and prohibit other apps from reading to prevent leakage.
The system will automatically detect whether website URLs in SMS messages are secure.
When sensitive words such as \"password \" or \"account \", or any bank account, appear in text messages, the system will remind you to deal with them carefully to prevent fraud.
